channel.title: BBC News - Wales

item.title: Covid: Parents to 'risk truancy fines' if school cases rise
item.description: One mum says she would keep her children off school if it kept her family "well and safe" from Covid.

item.title: Drink-driving: Wales has highest ratio of Britain's casualties
item.description: The RAC's Nicholas Lyes expressed "disappointment" with the Department for Transport figures.

item.title: Covid inquiry: Prof Hugh Pennington warns against Wales-only probe
item.description: Prof Hugh Pennington, who chaired the 2005 E. coli inquiry, says it would cause "enormous overlap".

item.title: Pembrokeshire hotel slated for Â£200 fee to deter instagrammers
item.description: Owner of the Druidstone Hotel says the clifftop bar was overrun by tourists wanting to see the sunset.

item.title: Bute Park: Hundreds march against vandalism at Cardiff beauty spot
item.description: The Reclaim Bute Park march was held in response to an attack on the night of 9 September.

item.title: Rhys Williams: Swansea City defender allegedly racially abused in draw at Luton Town
item.description: Swansea City say on-loan Liverpool defender Rhys Williams was allegedly racially abused during their 3-3 draw at Luton Town on Saturday.

item.title: Covid in Wales: Woman, 85, receives first care home booster jab
item.description: Anne Webb is believed to be the first care home resident in the UK to have a third vaccination.

item.title: Covid passes: Relief and concern at Wales announcement
item.description: Club owners fear passes may harm Christmas trade, but those at clinical risk say they feel comforted.

item.title: What is a Covid pass and how do I get one?
item.description: Covid passes will need to be shown for clubs and large events from 11 October.

item.title: Covid: Rise in unvaccinated pregnant women ill with Covid
item.description: Wales' Chief Medical Officer Dr Frank Atherton says pregnant women should get a Covid jab.

item.title: Planes turned into graffiti canvasses by street artist
item.description: Street artist Jim Vision had an idea for what to do with planes that have ended their flying days.

item.title: Climate change: Aberystwyth green department store opens
item.description: A green tour of Wales will also visit renewable energy projects, farmers and safe cycling schemes.

item.title: Drink-drivers are selfish, says Ammanford woman hit by car
item.description: Finley Taylor was hit by a drink-driver as she walked her dog with her husband.

item.title: Covid Passes to be compulsory at 'high risk' venues in Wales
item.description: The pass confirms your vaccination status or negative lateral flow test within the previous 48 hours.

item.title: Covid: Care homes were on their own, says widow
item.description: Running a care home during the pandemic contributed to Vernon Hough's suicide, his widow says.

item.title: Disused Carmarthenshire quarry 'needs to be protected'
item.description: There are fears wildlife will be harmed if a recycling faciity is developed at the site.

item.title: Electric cars: 'People with sight loss are in danger'
item.description: Blind and visually impaired people say quiet hybrid and electric vehicles put their lives in danger.

item.title: Covid: Doctor combating jab myths called Dr Death by trolls
item.description: Dr Bnar Talabani uses social media to dispel vaccine misinformation.

item.title: Cardiff City: Mick McCarthy upset by 'naughty' tackle by Bournemouth's Jefferson Lerma
item.description: Jefferson Lerma was lucky to not get a red card for a "naughty" tackle, says Cardiff City manager Mick McCarthy.

item.title: Russell Martin hopes memorable fightback at Luton will be Swansea City spark
item.description: Russell Martin hopes a memorable fightback at Luton can be the "spark that lights the fire" for Swansea City.

item.title: Cardiff City 0-1 Bournemouth: Cherries go top through Philip Billing goal
item.description: Bournemouth move top of the Championship as Philip Billing's second-half strike gives them victory at Cardiff City.

item.title: Luton Town 3-3 Swansea City: Swans claim point after remarkable second-half fightback
item.description: Swansea City fight back from 3-0 down to claim a point at Luton Town in remarkable fashion after a thrilling contest at Kenilworth Road.

item.title: Newport County 2-1 Walsall
item.description: James Clarke's late header gives Newport County victory against his former side Walsall.

item.title: Covid: 'Risg o ddirwy yn well nag anfon plant i'r ysgol'
item.description: Rhieni yn dewis rhwng iechyd eu teuluoedd ac addysg eu plant oherwydd rheolau presenoldeb "amhosib".

item.title: Cymru Ã¢'r ganran uchaf o anafiadau yfed a gyrru
item.description: Allan o 5,789 o ddioddefwyr gwrthdrawiadau yng Nghymru, roedd yfed a gyrru yn gyfrifol am 400 ohonynt yn 2019.

item.title: Ymateb cymysg wrth i Gymru gyflwyno pasys Covid
item.description: Croeso gan rai, megis ymgyrchwyr anabledd, ond eraill yn poeni am yr effaith ar letygarwch.

item.title: Brwydro i achub 'pensaernÃ¯aeth arbennig' Abertawe
item.description: Catrin James sy'n trafod sut gafodd Abertawe ei steil wedi'r Ail Ryfel Byd

item.title: Y Bencampwriaeth: Caerdydd 0-1 Bournemouth
item.description: GÃ´l Philip Billing yn yr ail hanner yn ddigon i sicrhau buddugoliaeth i'r Cherries yn erbyn Caerdydd.
